0.question_text: 1) Raja travelled 1/3 of his journey at a speed of 60 km/h and completed the remaining 240 km in 3 hours. Find the total distance he travelled.

1.question_text: 2) Raja set off on a 270km journey at 09:00. He drove at a speed of 80 km/h for the first 1 1/2 hours. For the rest of the journey, he drove at a speed of 60 km/h. At what time did he complete the journey?

2.question_text: 3) A train left Town A at 8:50 a.m., it passed Town B at 9:30 a.m. and arrived at Town C at 10:30 a.m. The distance between Town A and Town B is 100 km. Between Town B and Town C, the train travelled at 110 km/h. What was the average speed of the train for the whole journey?

3.question_text: 4) Raja travelled of his journey at 60 km/h. For the remaining 25 km he travelled at 30 km/h. How much time did he take for the whole journey?

4.question_text: 5) Rani took 30 minutes to cycle from school to her home at an average speed of 12 km/h. If she wanted to reach home 10 minutes early, what must her average speed be?

5.question_text: 6) Raja left home at 12.10 p.m. and walked to his grandmother's house. He walked at an average speed of 95 m/min. He arrived at 12:25 p.m. What is the distance between his house and his grandmother's house?

6.question_text: 7) A car is travelling at a speed of 50 km/h. How long will it take to travel a distance of 175 km?

7.question_text: 8) Raja travelled 2/5 of his journey at 50 km/h. The next 1/5 of his journey he travelled at 40 km/h. The remaining 40 km he covered in half an hour. How much time did he take for the whole journey?

8.question_text: 9) The children cycled between Camp A and Camp B which are 500 m apart in 50 seconds. If they wanted to reduce the time to 40 seconds, what is the increase in speed?

9.question_text: 10) A cheetah runs 100 metres in 3.5 seconds. A man runs the same distance in 10 seconds. During a 100 metre race, when the cheetah crossed the finishing line, how far back was the man?
